Transcript: Alison: I can't believe we just buried our best friend and nobody knows.

Jamal: What's that?

Alison: I'm glad that it wasn't you. Oh, God, please forgive me. I'm sorry,

Alison: It's Jack's blood.
Kevin: Lucy, not now.
Lucy: "Not now" what?

Kevin: Whatever you're sensing, whatever the universe is trying to tell you,

Lucy: No.
Kevin: And the girl happens to be my daughter.

Kevin: Yeah, well, you know what? He made me believe it for a minute, too.
Lucy: No. You saw it, too.
Kevin: Like I said, he's a good liar. He's a typical Ramsey.

Kevin: Yeah. Probably so he could keep trying to use her to get back at

Lucy: Ok. Livvie -- we had lunch, ok? And we were -- actually, we had a

Kevin: Lucy --

Lucy: Ok, ok, I'm sorry. She told me they went to the woods, Jack and Livvie,

Kevin: Ok. Why was it strange, and why didn't she tell me about it?
Lucy: Well, um, you're her dad. Maybe she just didn't want to worry you.
Kevin: Well, now I'm worried.

Lucy: No, it -- they were sort of camping, and Jack left for a minute to go

Kevin: Ok, you know what? Maybe I don't want to hear it.

Lucy: Yeah, you do. You need to hear this. He goes to get firewood, right?

Kevin: So what? He got lost, he fell. What happened?

Lucy: That's just the point. He doesn't know. Jack doesn't even remember, and

Kevin: And?

Lucy: I just think this has something to do with Jack not being here,

Kevin: Lucy --

Lucy: No, come on. Doc, you've heard the stories about how people just all of

Kevin: Yes, except in those few stories, the people are usually over 80 years

Lucy: Ok, fine. Fine. I will give you that. I don't know what happened. Maybe

Kevin: I think you may have just gotten your wish.
